dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news, uh, Michael Bloomberg, he's officially, like, saying no to a presidential run, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news, uh, Michael Bloomberg, he's officially, like, saying no to a presidential run, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I believe I would defeat Donald Trump in a general election, Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site. But I am clear-eyed about the difficulty of winning the Democratic nomination in such a crowded field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, it's been, um, speculated for a while, but he actually put out an editorial confirming it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, it's been, um, speculated for a while, but he actually put out an editorial confirming it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And what's interesting is his reasoning. He basically says he *could* beat Trump in a general election, but the Democratic nomination? [interrupts] Too tough in such a crowded field.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what's interesting is his reasoning. He basically says he could beat Trump in a general election, but the Democratic nomination? Too tough in such a crowded field.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I believe I would defeat Donald Trump in a general election, Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site. But I am clear-eyed about the difficulty of winning the Democratic nomination in such a crowded field.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, he called Trump a "threat to our country," like, really strong language there. And he slammed congressional Republicans too, for not holding Trump accountable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he called Trump a threat to our country, like, really strong language there. And he slammed congressional Republicans too, for not holding Trump accountable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the editorial, the former New York City mayor called Trump a threat to our country and emphasized the need to nominate a Democratic candidate who could beat him in the general election. Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which is, uh, pretty classic Bloomberg, honestly. And he himself was a Republican for a long time, don't forget. But here's the thing, even without running, he's still going to be a massive force, isn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which is, uh, pretty classic Bloomberg, honestly. And he himself was a Republican for a long time, don't forget. But here's the thing, even without running, he's still going to be a massive force, isn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, remember how he, uh, criticized Howard Schultz's potential independent bid, saying it would just split the anti-Trump vote?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, remember how he, uh, criticized Howard Schultz's potential independent bid, saying it would just split the anti-Trump vote?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In January, he obliquely criticized the possible candidacy of Howard Schultz, the billionaire founder of Starbucks, saying that the great likelihood is that an independent candidate would just split the anti-Trump vote and end up reelecting the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then there's the money. He's pledging, what, like, five hundred million of his own dollars to defeat Trump?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then there's the money. He's pledging, what, like, five hundred million of his own dollars to defeat Trump?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Five hundred million! Plus the hundred million he already spent helping Democrats in the 2018 midterms. [pauses] That's, uh, a lot of cash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Five hundred million! Plus the hundred million he already spent helping Democrats in the twenty eighteen midterms. That's, uh, a lot of cash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's insane. He's, like, one of the world's billionaires, right? So he's got it. And now he's focusing all that energy, and that money, on this new initiative called "Beyond Carbon."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's insane. He's, like, one of the world's billionaires, right? So he's got it. And now he's focusing all that energy, and that money, on this new initiative called Beyond Carbon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg is worth an estimated $55.6 billion; he placed ninth on Forbes 2019 rankings of the Worlds Billionaires. In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, moving America away from oil and gas, towards 100% clean energy. I mean, he's already done a lot with, um, shutting down coal plants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, moving America away from oil and gas, towards one hundred percent clean energy. I mean, he's already done a lot with, um, shutting down coal plants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy. His foundation has already worked to shutter coal-fired power plants and reduce air pollution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, even though he's not on the ballot, he's still, like, trying to shape the political landscape in a really significant way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, even though he's not on the ballot, he's still, like, trying to shape the political landscape in a really significant way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. He's, uh, still very much in the game, just from a different, you know, angle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. He's, uh, still very much in the game, just from a different, you know, angle.
